Indinesia:
Islam is thought to have become established in the Aceh region.
Aji Batara Agung Dewa Sakti founded Sultanate of Kutai in the Tepian Batu or Kutai Lama.
Philippine: The Rajahnate of Cebu was founded after the rebellion of Sri Lumay against the Maharajah of Chola Dynasty had succeeded.
Spain: Battle of Ponza (1300): An Aragonese-Angevin fleet defeated a Sicilian one near Ponza. John of Castile renounced his royal titles and declared his fealty to Ferdinand the Summoned.
Tonga: The Ha'amonga 'a Maui was built during the rule of Tu ªi Tonga Tu'itatui.
